subject: PE Today: How To Fix Campaign News
body:
CBSNews.com












Pop Up PoliticsIn today’s New York 
      Times, columnist Paul Krugman takes the media to 
      task for its coverage of Campaign 2008 thus far.  It’s easy to pick on the media for 
      its surface-level coverage of the presidential candidates, but a little harder to try and think of 
      an alternative. Think no further, dear readers: Public Eye has a plan.[+ Read More]

Soccer Story ScareAn "Early Show" segment yesterday focused on the 
      hidden dangers that soccer goals can pose to small children.  
      With 14 million children in America playing organized soccer, this is 
      an issue worth reporting on.  But the story could have been done without trafficking in the 
      alarmist Your Kids Are At Risk rhetoric that the makes the media such an 
      easy target. [+ Read More]

A Flight To ParisLast 
      night, "Evening News" anchor Katie Couric uttered the dreaded two words 
      that she had vowed never to speak on the show: Paris. Hilton. In Boston a 
      month ago, Couric had said, “We have 
      a precious amount of time on the CBS 'Evening News' and I don’t think we 
      need to ever utter the name Paris
Hilton."  Why the change of heart?[+ Read More]
